WRAP 1.3
  • Vignettes
  • Functions
  • Package Building

Reference

Simulating

Functions for simulating presence/absence and abundance grids using environmental variables. These functions return an OM object.

SimulateWorld()

Simulated World basic

SimulateWorld_ROMS()

Simulated World ROMS

SimulateWorld_ROMS_TrophicInteraction()

Simulated World ROMS Trophic Interactions

OMclass

OM class

Fitting

Functions for fitting SDMs using GAMs, Boosted Regression Trees (BRT), and Neural Nets (MLP). These functions take as input, a OM object as returned by the simulation functions above. The OM object has information (in object$meta) about the simulation that is used in the fitting function.

gam_sdm()

SDM fit with gam

brt_sdm()

SDM fit with BRT

mlp_sdm()

SDM fit with MLP

OM Methods

The simulation functions return an OM object (a list) with meta and grid. meta has information on the simulation and grid is the simulated grid (as a data frame with lat lon). The following methods are available in addition to the fitting functions above.

predict(<OM>)

Predict for OM object

print(<OM>)

Prints OM object

plot_cog()

Plots COG from SDM

Misc

Helper functions

dev_eval()

Extract explained deviance from BRT
